security: The memo regarding COINTELPRO mentions legal memoranda that the Bureau representatives objected to sharing with the Senate Select Committee. Revealing these memoranda could expose sensitive legal strategies and potentially compromise future operations.
summary: This document contains memoranda, a teletype, and a letter addressing responses to congressional committee requests, COINTELPRO concerns, and an inquiry regarding an FBI informant within a legal service agency.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents includes internal communications within the FBI and external correspondence addressing inquiries from congressional committees and other entities. One memorandum discusses the status of responses to various congressional committees, including the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities, concerning requests for information on FBI jurisdiction and COINTELPRO. An airtel details the return of material related to 'SENSTUDY 75' by a former Special Agent in Atlanta, and a teletype confirms the lack of communications from a former agent related to the Democratic National Convention disruption. Additionally, a letter to Congressman Charles E. Wiggins addresses the use of an FBI informant within the New Orleans Legal Assistance Corps, clarifying the informant's role and the FBI's intentions.
tags: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
title: Responses to Congressional Committee Requests, COINTELPRO, and FBI Informant Inquiry
recipient: Mr. J. B. Adams/Director, FBI/Congressman Charles E. Wiggins
sender: Legal Counsel/SAC, Atlanta/FROM NEWARK/Clarence M. Kelley
